subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Carl Edwards watched Kyle Busch lead 415 consecutive laps Saturday night at Bristol Motor Speedway in Tennessee, then used his bumper to nudge Busch in the first turn on the 470th lap of 500. That move caused Busch’s car to wiggle just enough so that Edwards could drive by on his way to his second consecutive Nascar Sprint Cup victory.
